Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: David Harris Jr. The Pulse
programme.desc: David Harris Jr. delivers hard hitting analysis and opinion of latest news and events.

programme.title: Cops Under Fire
programme.desc: Crime and killings are sweeping the nation and Chicago is ground zero. Newsmax takes you inside the crime capital of the world as a street cop risks his career and discusses the desperate state of crime in America and on the streets.

programme.title: America's Longest War
programme.desc: Over a trillion dollars spent, over 50 thousand SWAT raids yearly, and since 2012 - more than 100 thousand murders in Mexico alone! The war on drugs is an international effort of enormous scale.

programme.title: Elvis and the Memphis Mafia
programme.desc: Elvis Presley had a select group of friends he entrusted with his life. Through never-before-seen interviews this documentary explores Elvis' life through the eyes of the Memphis mafia.

programme.title: Wendy Bell Common Sense
programme.desc: Veteran broadcaster Wendy Bell takes a deep dive into tough issues with guests from across the country.

programme.title: Rob Carson’s What in the World?
programme.desc: Rob Carson dissects politics, cultural phenomena, and absurdity confronting us every day in America with humor and satire.

programme.title: First Edition
programme.desc: Start your day with a thorough overview of the latest news, insightful commentary, and expert analysis.

programme.title: Newsfront
programme.desc: A weaponized Department of Justice and rogue district attorneys target President Donald Trump, his aides, and his supporters at the height of the 2024 election season.

programme.title: The Wendy Bell Show

programme.title: John Bachman Now
programme.desc: John Bachman Now shares breaking news and informed commentary and analysis from a broad range of top experts.

programme.title: National Desk
programme.desc: From Newsmax Studios in Washington DC, National Desk gives you the latest news updates, analysis, exclusive interviews, with unique perspective on breaking news, politics, and current events.

programme.title: Newswire
programme.desc: Up to the minute news updates, in-depth analysis, exclusive interviews and a fresh perspective on the day's top stories and key developments in breaking news, politics and current events.

programme.desc: Former NY Mayor Rudy Giuliani gives insight on leadership, courage, and the most pressing issues of our time.

programme.title: Newsmax News In-Depth
programme.desc: Bianca de la Garza looks at the big stories of the week, politics, policy, the economy, and much more!

programme.title: Jackie O: A Remarkable Life
programme.desc: Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis captivated the world as first lady with grace and elegance. But behind the glamorous facade was a woman of resilience, navigating unimaginable loss and triumph.

programme.title: Ed Henry The Briefing
programme.desc: Catch the latest headline and in-depth analysis on The Briefing, your go-to news show for a comprehensive afternoon update, with a dynamic blend of breaking news, politics, and business.

programme.desc: Rick Leventhal delivers comprehensive analysis and exclusive interviews on current affairs and significant events from home and abroad.

programme.desc: David Harris Jr. delivers hard hitting analysis and opinion of latest news and events.

programme.title: Newsfront
programme.desc: A weaponized Department of Justice and rogue district attorneys target President Donald Trump, his aides, and his supporters at the height of the 2024 election season.

programme.title: The Biden Chronicles
programme.desc: Wars and conflict explode worldwide. Where's the money for Ukraine going? Chris Plante recounts Biden's withdrawal from Afghanistan, approach to Russia, and wavering support for Israel.

programme.title: The Biden Chronicles
programme.desc: Biden moves to ban gas grills and stoves and declares war on gas-powered cars. His administration struggles to promote electric cars. And spending trillions on climate initiatives based on shaky claims?

programme.title: A Climate Conversation
programme.desc: Cuts through the rhetoric and propaganda to ask the simple questions, grounded in science and free of political cheap shots.

programme.title: Titanic Arrogance
programme.desc: 100 years ago, the Titanic was launched. See the revealing litany of human errors, from the building process to the tragic events that led her to be rammed into the iceberg that sank her.

programme.title: Presidents and UFOs: The Surprising Story
programme.desc: A history of UFO's and Presidents, from George Washington to Donald Trump, with expert testimony, interviews, and reports of personal encounters involving U.S. Presidents and unexplained paranormal phenomena.

programme.title: The President’s Men: Tales From the Secret Service
programme.desc: Protecting presidents and their families is the job of the brave men and women of the US Secret Service. They'd take a bullet! Their stories give a glimpse into the lives of the leaders of the free world. Based on Ronald Kessler's best-selling book.

programme.title: The Freedom File: Judge Napolitano
programme.desc: Judge Napolitano provides commentary on current events, drawing on his expertise in constitutional law to protect individual freedoms in his legal and political news coverage.

programme.desc: John Bachman focuses on the biggest news from D.C., N.Y., and around America!

programme.desc: Bianca de la Garza looks at the big stories of the week, politics, policy, the economy, and much more!

programme.desc: Founder of the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure Nancy Brinker talks with the top newsmakers, celebs, and captains of industry on their lives, politics, and more.

programme.desc: Greta Van Susteren gives the big news from D.C., N.Y., across America, and around the world.

programme.desc: Greg Kelly gives hardest-hitting reports and analysis from L.A. to N.Y., from Beltway to Rust Belt, talking with you and for you!

programme.title: The Freedom File: Judge Napolitano
programme.desc: Judge Napolitano provides commentary on current events, drawing on his expertise in constitutional law to protect individual freedoms in his legal and political news coverage.

programme.title: Carl Higbie This Week
programme.desc: Carl Higbie gives common-sense news analysis, exposes big government and media bias, as he fights for American values.

programme.title: David Harris Jr. The Pulse Weekly
programme.desc: David Harris Jr. delivers hard-hitting analysis and opinion of the latest news and events.

programme.title: Rob Schmitt This Week
programme.desc: Rob Schmitt wraps up all the latest news and opinion and sets the stage for tomorrow.

programme.title: FBI: Abuse of Power
programme.desc: The FBI's raid of Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago was unprecedented and created enormous controversy. Rob Schmitt looks at the issues.

programme.title: Upheaval: The Journey of Menachem Begin
programme.desc: The life of Israeli Prime Minister Menachem Begin, a proud and scarred leader haunted by the Holocaust and war who was able to make peace with his greatest enemy.

programme.title: Choose Life: It’s Worth It
programme.desc: Women who made the decision to place their babies for adoption, and people adopted as infants share their compelling stories.

programme.title: Biblical Prophecy: The End Times
programme.desc: Examines how world events are lining up with Christian and Jewish eschatology. Biblical experts explain how major events today warn of what is to come.

programme.title: The Footprints of Jesus in Rome
programme.desc: This documentary investigates the origins and historical repercussions of the numerous relics of Jesus and his disciples in the Eternal City.

programme.title: Oh My God!
programme.desc: Join host Tevya Heller on this cultural journey in his search for God. It's an inviting and insightful look at the spiritual teachings, customs, and daily lives of families of different faiths.

programme.title: Jesus in Jerusalem: His Story
programme.desc: A look at Jesus' last week on Earth. From the Mt. of Olives to the Upper Room where He had the Last Supper - where He waited for trial, possible burial, and resurrection place, and where He ascended into Heaven.

programme.title: King of Cool: The Dean Martin Story
programme.desc: Dean Martin was an undeniable singing, acting and stage sensation. Newsmax celebrates the man behind the martini glass.

programme.title: 1968: The Year Everything Fell Apart
programme.desc: 1968 started out with renewed hope for Americans, but quickly turned into a roller coaster year of ups and downs with riots, social divisiveness, and assassinations.

programme.title: 1969: A Summer Like No Other
programme.desc: Historian Craig Shirley narrates the amazing and momentous 1969 with Neil Armstrong walking on the moon to the many tumultuous events like Sen. Ted Kennedy's Chappaquiddick tragedy, the Charles Manson murders, the Vietnam War, and Woodstock.

programme.title: D-Day: The Day That Won the War
programme.desc: Exploring the strategic gambles that became the most decisive victory for the Allied forces.

programme.title: Greta Van Susteren: Broken Governments
programme.desc: Greta Van Susteren travels to Necoclí, Colombia, the epicenter for migrants aiming for the United States, and spotlights the growing crisis at our southern border.

programme.title: The Plot Against the President
programme.desc: The true story of how Congressman Devin Nunes uncovered the operation to bring down the President of the United States.

programme.title: The Big Focus
programme.desc: John Bachman focuses on the biggest news from D.C., N.Y., and around America!

programme.title: The Freedom File: Judge Napolitano
programme.desc: Judge Napolitano provides commentary on current events, drawing on his expertise in constitutional law to protect individual freedoms in his legal and political news coverage.

programme.title: Watched! Big Government Is Watching, Listening, and Monitoring Almost Everything You Do
programme.desc: Every American with a cell phone, or filing taxes is under surveillance. Your constitutional right to privacy has been compromised! Find out How.

programme.title: Foul Play: Athletes Speak Out

programme.title: Chain Reaction

programme.title: Chain Reaction

programme.title: Catch 21

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Master Minds
programme.desc: Three challengers take on some of the great minds in trivia in a showdown of smarts and strategy; the last contestant standing will face off against the highest scoring Master Mind in a head-to-head battle.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: Game show series have been making a comeback in television, and media and "America Says" is no exception. This program is following in the footsteps of the popular mobile app game "HQ Trivia." The network is planning its own spin on the game show, and Fran Shea, evp, programming and marketing, says she "has been studying the GSN audience and prepared a slate of new shows that reflect what it wants: family-friendly, fun, escapist television." In "America Says," two teams face off to guess Americans' responses to questions covering a variety of topics. Michael Higgins is the host.

programme.title: Flip Side
programme.desc: The hilarious new survey game show explores answers to questions from differing perspectives; host Jaleel White.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: This incarnation of the word-association game show that dates back, in various forms, to the early '80s is hosted by radio personality Mike Catherwood ("Loveline"). The premise is simple: two teams try to complete chains of seven words. The first and last word in each chain are revealed, and the contestants must guess the missing words, with one letter being revealed each turn. Each link in the chain forms a compound word or phrase with the word before and/or after it. Teams earn money for each word they guess correctly, and the team with the most money at the end of the game goes on to the bonus round, dubbed the Super Chain, for a chance to add an additional $5,000 to the total the team won during the main part of the game.

programme.title: Beat the Bridge
programme.desc: An interactive bridge dares players to cross by stepping on the right answers to challenging trivia questions; each step forward puts money in the team's bank, with bonus money for each successful crossing.

programme.title: Beat the Bridge
programme.desc: An interactive bridge dares players to cross by stepping on the right answers to challenging trivia questions; each step forward puts money in the team's bank, with bonus money for each successful crossing.

programme.title: Tic Tac Dough
programme.desc: Two contestants compete to place three marks in a row on trivia board avoiding a dragon that can steal turns; the winner faces the dragon in a final round where it blocks three-in-a-row attempts to prevent the $10,000 prize win.

programme.title: Bingo Blitz
programme.desc: Contestants compete in a dynamic blend of trivia and bingo.

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Everyday people battle a variety of trivia questions and a 40-foot wall for a chance to win millions of dollars. Each pair of deserving contestants, from siblings to spouses to best friends, has a plan to use the life-changing winnings for good things. But defeating the wall is no easy feat. Executive Producer LeBron James' game is a true test of both knowledge and poise. With momentary changes between fortune and failure, the outcome is as unpredictable as the bounce of the ball.

programme.title: Press Your Luck
programme.desc: Three contestants compete against one another in a game of wits and strategy, answering questions to earn spins on the Big Board. The stakes get even higher when the contestants get the chance to use their spins to win cash and prizes while trying to avoid the WHAMMY, who could take all of their winnings and leave them with nothing. The winning contestant moves on to the bonus round to face the WHAMMY in a final battle for the chance to win a fortune.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: Game show series have been making a comeback in television, and media and "America Says" is no exception. This program is following in the footsteps of the popular mobile app game "HQ Trivia." The network is planning its own spin on the game show, and Fran Shea, evp, programming and marketing, says she "has been studying the GSN audience and prepared a slate of new shows that reflect what it wants: family-friendly, fun, escapist television." In "America Says," two teams face off to guess Americans' responses to questions covering a variety of topics. Michael Higgins is the host.

programme.title: Tic Tac Dough

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Airing from 2005 to 2009 on NBC, the game show series returns to primetime TV with original host Howie Mandel. A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash - from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.desc: Three challengers take on some of the great minds in trivia in a showdown of smarts and strategy; the last contestant standing will face off against the highest scoring Master Mind in a head-to-head battle.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: Game show series have been making a comeback in television, and media and "America Says" is no exception. programme.title: Flip Side
programme.desc: The hilarious new survey game show explores answers to questions from differing perspectives; host Jaleel White.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: This incarnation of the word-association game show that dates back, in various forms, to the early '80s is hosted by radio personality Mike Catherwood ("Loveline"). The premise is simple: two teams try to complete chains of seven words. The first and last word in each chain are revealed, and the contestants must guess the missing words, with one letter being revealed each turn. Each link in the chain forms a compound word or phrase with the word before and/or after it. Teams earn money for each word they guess correctly, and the team with the most money at the end of the game goes on to the bonus round, dubbed the Super Chain, for a chance to add an additional $5,000 to the total the team won during the main part of the game.

programme.title: Beat the Bridge
programme.desc: An interactive bridge dares players to cross by stepping on the right answers to challenging trivia questions; each step forward puts money in the team's bank, with bonus money for each successful crossing.

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Everyday people battle a variety of trivia questions and a 40-foot wall for a chance to win millions of dollars. Each pair of deserving contestants, from siblings to spouses to best friends, has a plan to use the life-changing winnings for good things. But defeating the wall is no easy feat. Executive Producer LeBron James' game is a true test of both knowledge and poise. With momentary changes between fortune and failure, the outcome is as unpredictable as the bounce of the ball.

programme.title: Press Your Luck
programme.desc: Three contestants compete against one another in a game of wits and strategy, answering questions to earn spins on the Big Board. The stakes get even higher when the contestants get the chance to use their spins to win cash and prizes while trying to avoid the WHAMMY, who could take all of their winnings and leave them with nothing. The winning contestant moves on to the bonus round to face the WHAMMY in a final battle for the chance to win a fortune.

programme.title: People Puzzler
programme.desc: Leah Remini hosts the show, which features three contestants who put their pop culture knowledge to the test to complete crosswords from the pop culture magazine. During a player's turn, one word out of 10 is chosen from the board. The contestant is then shown the first unrevealed letter in the word, and a clue is given, with correct answers scoring points based on the word. The player who wins the most points after three rounds moves forward to the fast puzzle bonus round, where they get the opportunity to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: Game show series have been making a comeback in television, and media and "America Says" is no exception. This program is following in the footsteps of the popular mobile app game "HQ Trivia." The network is planning its own spin on the game show, and Fran Shea, evp, programming and marketing, says she "has been studying the GSN audience and prepared a slate of new shows that reflect what it wants: family-friendly, fun, escapist television." In "America Says," two teams face off to guess Americans' responses to questions covering a variety of topics. Michael Higgins is the host.

programme.title: Flip Side

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: This incarnation of the word-association game show that dates back, in various forms, to the early '80s is hosted by radio personality Mike Catherwood ("Loveline"). The premise is simple: two teams try to complete chains of seven words. The first and last word in each chain are revealed, and the contestants must guess the missing words, with one letter being revealed each turn. Each link in the chain forms a compound word or phrase with the word before and/or after it. Teams earn money for each word they guess correctly, and the team with the most money at the end of the game goes on to the bonus round, dubbed the Super Chain, for a chance to add an additional $5,000 to the total the team won during the main part of the game.

programme.title: The Prosperous Life
programme.desc: Gloria Copeland and Pastor George Pearsons reveal from Scripture that it is God's will for people to be prosperous in every area of their lives.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Friend Zone A shipment from Faith Cattle Company is in jeopardy when the truck gets stuck in a ditch. It's a race against the clock to get the cattle to the buyer or risk losing the deal. Bubba teams up with his father-in-law to build a custom grill prototype in hopes of launching a new business venture. Cody decides to sell a horse to help fund his dream home, but he receives an offer that is less than ideal. After getting relationship advice from Bubba and Cody, Booger ends up on a date with his best friend Ashley.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E5 Is It a Boy or a Girl? Before heading out for the day's work, Bubba notices one of his colts is missing, and the guys go searching for the young horse before it is injured. At the urging of his grandmother, Booger ventures into the world of Internet dating, hoping to find a serious girlfriend. After Bubba's trusted horse gets sick, he asks Booger to help him break in a new colt. Cody and Misty finally find out if they are having a little cowboy or cowgirl, and they plan a party to reveal the gender to friends and family.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E7 The Martinet Cavalry Captain Josiah Perry, a disciplined military man, learns his son, Lon, died in a North Fork gunfight with Lucas. Perry is bent on making Lucas pay for Lon's death. Perry's other son, Ben, tries to keep his dad from facing the same fate.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E8 Miss Milly A young, naïve woman who doesn't have any business experience comes to North Fork and purchases the general store from Hattie Denton. A newcomer and his partner con her by posing as collection agents, putting the town's citizens in danger.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E1 They Killed Me Frontiersman Jim Bridger spins an incredible tale to a group of settlers, claiming he was once killed by Blackfeet warriors yet somehow lived to tell the tale. They think he's joking, but Bridger soon proves that he really did rise from the dead.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E4 Brothers in Arms When they are ambushed by a Blackfeet war party, Jim Bridger and a lone Shoshone brave must work together to find a way to defeat their common enemy. If they can't overcome their suspicions and learn to trust each other, they may not survive the day.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E8 The Many Faces of Charles Siringo Unable to apprehend the train-robbing Smith Brothers, Sheriff Doc Shores calls the Pinkerton Detective Agency for assistance. The agency sends Charles Siringo, an undercover specialist known for his unorthodox methods of capturing criminals.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E2 Billy the Kid: Birth of an Outlaw Teenaged fugitive William Bonney is given a second chance when a kindhearted ranch owner offers him a job. But when his new employer is killed in cold blood, Bonney reverts to his criminal ways, seeking vengeance and transforming into Billy the Kid.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S2 E6 Tom Fitzpatrick: Steadfast Frontiersman By the 1840s, the fur trade is ending, forcing lifelong frontiersmen like Tom Fitzpatrick to adapt. When he becomes a guide for some of the first Americans to emigrate to California, he faces new dangers even as his way of life is becoming obsolete.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S4 E8 The Longhorn Goodbye The remaining 6 cowboys face off in a cutting competition that turns out to be more difficult than expected. Then, they work as a team to sort 4 rogue cattle from a herd and load them on a trailer. Host Trace Adkins and the judges send a cowboy home.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E12 Hard Time The Kid tries to help a woman in the corrupt small town of Prosperity but, while there, he finds himself in trouble with the law. When the sheriff sentences The Kid to hard labor, the riders suspect something is not quite right, and come to his aid.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Sister Rebecca Snipe returns to North Fork after an extended visit. Lucas' son Mark is smitten and plans to play matchmaker for his dad. However, the Snipe brothers get involved to make sure Lucas is good enough for Rebecca.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E10 New Orleans Menace Wealthy Frenchman Cesar Tiffauges, who is used to getting whatever he desires, wants to buy the McCain Ranch. Tiffauges, a sadistic man, abuses his followers regularly with beatings. When Lucas refuses, his son Mark becomes the object of cruelty.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E11 The Apprentice Sheriff Dan Willard fills in as deputy while Marshal Micah Torrance is away on business. Meanwhile, Texas cowhands come to town looking for fun and relaxation. When Dan tries to prove that his toughness, those actions backfire.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E12 The Angry Gun Lucas and Mark, returning after selling their herd, share the stagecoach trip with a marshal and his prisoner, Johnny Cotton. Johnny's gang stops and robs the stagecoach, while Johnny steals Lucas' gun and profits. Lucas is forced to track him down.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E10 The Gamble Cheyenne helps an old friend by helping her keep her saloon from crooked gamblers. The woman's daughter who has been back east in school, will be arriving back in town soon, but she knows nothing about how her mother earned money for her education.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E11 Renegades Cheyenne fulfills a dying war hero's wish and helps his son enlist in the Army. Cheyenne arrives at Fort Sumner with Jed Wayne, but trouble soon arises from a demanding colonel and the Comanche Indians' imminent uprising.

programme.title: Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: A homesteading family in 1867 Wyoming faces a crisis when the husband is killed and the wife must decide whether to remain or take her son and daughter back East.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E9 Elfego Baca & the Frisco Shootout Just days on the job and brandishing a homemade badge, nineteen-year-old Deputy Elfego Baca's courage is immediately put to the test. After arresting a drunken cowboy for shooting up a saloon, Baca faces down the cowboy's friends, who are hired guns for a wealthy rancher. He wins the first skirmish, but the cowboys return with reinforcements and the stage is set for the biggest and longest gunfight in Old West history. Baca seeks shelter in a small adobe house and makes his stand against a small army of men who shoot up the house with thousands of rounds of ammunition over the course of 33 hours. Years later, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson gets the real story of what comes to be known as the Frisco Shootout from the former sheriff who deputized Baca just prior to the legendary gun battle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E9 Dead Cold Cash Sara Caruthers, the deceased widow of a bandit Lucas shot when he was a deputy marshal, has an unusal will to get revenge against McCain. It stipulates that $100,000 be divided among North Fork residents if Lucas dies within seven days of her death.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E10 The Schoolmaster Mr. Griswald is the new North Fork schoolmaster. As a harsh disciplinarian, he quickly clashes with Mark and his friend one too many times. When the boys decide to play hooky from school, they find big trouble when they get trapped in an old mine.

programme.title: Buffalo Keepers
programme.desc: S1 E1 Today, the buffalo is the quintessential symbol of strength, freedom, and the unspoiled American West. But in the late 1800s, the nation's buffalo were nearly wiped out by ruthless hide hunters. Those majestic herds, which once numbered in the tens of millions, were down to less than 500 animals. This is the story of the handful of determined men and women who mobilized to save the ones that were left in a last-ditch effort to stave off extinction. Ranchers like Charles and Mary Ann Goodnight rescued orphaned buffalo calves and built small herds. Former buffalo hunters like Buffalo Bill helped build public sympathy. And politicians like Theodore Roosevelt helped pass laws to protect the remaining animals. The effort would be a generational one, with buffalo herds carefully tended, bred, and passed down to new stewards when their old protectors passed away. Thanks to their efforts, there are an estimated 500,000 buffalo thundering across America's grasslands once again.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E10 The Discoveries of George McJunkin After a devastating storm, ranch foreman George McJunkin finds ancient bison fossils and flint points unearthed in a riverbank, and he sets out to find someone in the scientific community who will acknowledge the importance of his discovery.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E7 Calamity Jane Saves the Day Throughout Deadwood, Calamity Jane is known as a hot-tempered drunk. But when a deadly smallpox outbreak spreads through town, Calamity Jane works tirelessly to save the lives of the infected citizens who once treated her with such contempt.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E6 Christopher Gist: Unsung Hero of the First Frontier After mapping the rugged Ohio Country, frontiersman and surveyor Christopher Gist accepts a new mission: lead a young George Washington to a remote French fort in the Ohio wilderness on a diplomatic journey which may change the course of history.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S4 E9 The Final Five The five remaining cowboys get to show off their skills starting wild colts and taking them through an obstacle course. Then, they must rope and load as many steers as they can in 30 minutes. Host Trace Adkins and the judges eliminate two cowboys.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E13 Lady for a Night While out on a run, Lou stops by a shop in a small town to buy a dress. A man invites her to have dinner with him. Obsessed with Lou, the man follows her back to Sweetwater and masterminds a series of heists.

programme.title: Sitting Bull
programme.desc: A U.S. Cavalry officer begins to understand the plight of the Sioux and arranges a meeting between Chief Sitting Bull and President Grant.

programme.title: Cavalry Charge
programme.desc: When two brothers each decide to fight on opposite sides in the Civil War, they never dreamed they would need to reunite and fight together. It is the only chance they have, if they hope to survive a brutal Indian attack.

programme.title: Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: A homesteading family in 1867 Wyoming faces a crisis when the husband is killed and the wife must decide whether to remain or take her son and daughter back East.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E9 Elfego Baca & the Frisco Shootout Just days on the job and brandishing a homemade badge, nineteen-year-old Deputy Elfego Baca's courage is immediately put to the test. After arresting a drunken cowboy for shooting up a saloon, Baca faces down the cowboy's friends, who are hired guns for a wealthy rancher. He wins the first skirmish, but the cowboys return with reinforcements and the stage is set for the biggest and longest gunfight in Old West history. Baca seeks shelter in a small adobe house and makes his stand against a small army of men who shoot up the house with thousands of rounds of ammunition over the course of 33 hours. Years later, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson gets the real story of what comes to be known as the Frisco Shootout from the former sheriff who deputized Baca just prior to the legendary gun battle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E9 Dead Cold Cash Sara Caruthers, the deceased widow of a bandit Lucas shot when he was a deputy marshal, has an unusal will to get revenge against McCain. It stipulates that $100,000 be divided among North Fork residents if Lucas dies within seven days of her death.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E10 The Schoolmaster Mr. Griswald is the new North Fork schoolmaster. As a harsh disciplinarian, he quickly clashes with Mark and his friend one too many times. When the boys decide to play hooky from school, they find big trouble when they get trapped in an old mine.

programme.title: Sitting Bull
programme.desc: A U.S. Cavalry officer begins to understand the plight of the Sioux and arranges a meeting between Chief Sitting Bull and President Grant.

programme.title: Cavalry Charge
programme.desc: When two brothers each decide to fight on opposite sides in the Civil War, they never dreamed they would need to reunite and fight together. It is the only chance they have, if they hope to survive a brutal Indian attack.

programme.title: Kansas Pacific
programme.desc: With talks of a Civil War brewing, Southern saboteurs know they must keep Northern forces from using the U.S. train system. They devise a daring and dangerous plan to stop and capture a railroad engine, preventing the completion of a railroad line.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E8 The Gold Rush Lawman When failed prospector John Hicks Adams is elected sheriff of Santa Clara County, he must prove that he won't be a bust as a lawman too. Just weeks into the job, his courage is tested when a band of stagecoach robbers begins terrorizing the area.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E29 The Day a Town Slept Lucas and Mark return to North Fork after a hunting trip to discover Marshal Micah Torrance has been voted out. Smooth-talking newcomer Ben Judson is now in charge and his friendship with a wanted outlaw has Lucas suspicious.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E30 Milly's Brother Harry Chase moves to North Fork and courts Milly Scott, the owner of the general store. He impresses her with his heroic Civil War stories and claims he knew her brother who was killed in action. Lucas is suspicious and suspects he is a fraud.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E31 Outlaw's Shoes Lucas rides to a nearby town to see the gunsmith to get a new spring for his rifle. On the way, two gunmen ambush Lucas, knocking him unconscious. When Lucas awakens, he has amnesia and thinks he is one of the outlaws, George Vale, who is wanted.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E32 The Executioner Russell Ganaway, a former neighbor of Lucas', is released from prison and asks for a job on the McCain Ranch. Years ago, Ganaway was found guilty of a robbing a stage and the money was never found. Lucas agrees but soon realizes he's hiding a secret.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E1 Joe Meek: A Fearless Fighter Already a seasoned mountain man, Joe Meek has a reputation for raw courage and bravery among the trappers of the west. But Meek becomes a frontier legend when he risks his life in a fearless charge to save the woman that he loves from Crow warriors.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E3 Bronco Bill's Treasure When Bronco Bill and his gang are robbing trains at will, two veteran lawmen join forces to stop the violent outlaws once and for all. Years later, gunfighter-turned-reporter Bat Masterson hears the story from the last surviving member of the gang.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E4 Ada Curnutt, U.S. Deputy Marshal After being sworn in as one of Oklahoma's first female deputy marshals, Ada Curnutt volunteers to track down two killers-turned-counterfeiters and concocts a cunning plan to bring them to justice without using a gun.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E9 The Beholden Cheyenne arrives in Winslow with a letter recommending him for the marshal's job. As he delivers it to the banker the next morning, Elijah McGuire and his men rob the bank, and Cheyenne finds himself caught in the middle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E17 Hero While hunting, Colly Vane encounters a dangerous outlaw, The Domino Kid, who forces Vane to shoot him. When he brings the body back to town, it's discovered he was shot in the back. Instead of being a hero, Vane faces danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E18 The Horse Traders Kansas Sawyer is Lucas' friend who was cheated in a horse-trading deal. Lucas investigates Colonel Bourbon's operation and discovers his illegal process. He also learns that the horse Sawyer bought was stolen and is being sought after by outlaws.

programme.title: McLintock!
programme.desc: A cattle baron awaits the return of his daughter from school and is surprised that his wife has returned to take their daughter away. He tries to keep the peace and do what is best for everyone.

programme.title: Yuma
programme.desc: When a tough, veteran United States marshal is sent to clean up a down-and-dirty Western town, he faces a scheme to remove his authority and ruin his reputation.

programme.title: Kansas Pacific
programme.desc: With talks of a Civil War brewing, Southern saboteurs know they must keep Northern forces from using the U.S. train system. They devise a daring and dangerous plan to stop and capture a railroad engine, preventing the completion of a railroad line.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E18 The Horse Traders Kansas Sawyer is Lucas' friend who was cheated in a horse-trading deal. Lucas investigates Colonel Bourbon's operation and discovers his illegal process. He also learns that the horse Sawyer bought was stolen and is being sought after by outlaws.

programme.title: McLintock!
programme.desc: A cattle baron awaits the return of his daughter from school and is surprised that his wife has returned to take their daughter away. He tries to keep the peace and do what is best for everyone.

programme.title: Yuma
programme.desc: When a tough, veteran United States marshal is sent to clean up a down-and-dirty Western town, he faces a scheme to remove his authority and ruin his reputation.

programme.title: County Line
programme.desc: When his best friend, Sheriff Clint Thorne (Jeff Fahey, Texas Rising, Justified), is brutally gunned down, former neighboring county sheriff, Alden Rockwell (Tom Wopat, The Dukes Of Hazzard, Longmire) is left with many questions and no answers. After the investigation stalls and his replacement, Sheriff Preston (Grant Goodeve, Eight is Enough, Dynasty) turns a blind eye, Alden takes the case into his own hands. Uncovering a web of crime, deceit, and corruption that spreads through two counties, Alden is caught in a deadly criminal network with no backup, no badge, and local diner owner, Maddie (Patricia Richardson, Home Improvement, The West Wing) as his only ally. Seeking justice at any cost, Alden must find out who's behind this criminal enterprise, even if some lines must be crossed.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E5 The Presence of Mine Enemies Ike meets and falls in love with Emily Metcalfe. When a card shark named Neville murders her gambler father, Emily seeks revenge. Ike intervenes in her plans to try to protect her, but suffers from a gunshot in the process.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E17 The Sixteenth Cousin The big day finally arrives in North Fork as the first train comes to town. Onboard are Lucas and Mark along with a Japanese nobleman and his servant. When bullies harass the foreign visitors, the pair quickly teaches them a lesson in good manners.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E18 Hostages to Fortune On Halloween, Mark and his friends wear masks and go from ranch to ranch to play pranks. Knowing the boys will be blamed, rustlers wear similar masks to steal cattle. Lucas thinks the boys are mixed up in the theft, until he finds out the truth.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E6 Sister Blandina and the Killer When a bloodthirsty mob storms a jailhouse holding a man accused of attempted murder, they are confronted by a 22-year-old missionary from the Sisters of Charity. Only Sister Blandina can stop the vigilantes from taking the law into their own hands.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E9 Law Comes to No Man's Land Marshal Chris Madsen helps newly appointed judge John Buford bring law and order to Oklahoma's Panhandle in an area known as No Man's Land. After escorting a wagon train of prisoners to Beaver City, they set up their first courthouse inside a saloon.

programme.title: Legends of the Stagecoach
programme.desc: A marvel of engineering, the iconic stagecoach becomes indispensable when Americans settle the West. As stagecoaches and their heroic drivers navigate perilous trails to transport passengers and valuables, they are easy targets for lawless bandits.

programme.title: The Legend of 5 Mile Cave
programme.desc: A boy enchanted with tales from the Old West unlocks a mystery that could save their family farm. While his widowed mother struggles to avoid foreclosure, a mysterious stranger arrives looking for a room to rent. A bond with the boy grows as the drifter recounts breathtaking stories of Shooter Green, a legendary gunslinger accused of Arizona's biggest gold robbery. The truth is revealed, along with the secret of the drifter's past when a crooked lawman appears, hot on the trail of the stolen gold. Past and present collide in this tale of action, adventure and drama. Stars Adam Baldwin (The Last Ship, Full Metal Jacket, The Patriot), Jeremy Sumpter (Peter Pan, Soul Surfer), Jill Wagner (Braven, Christmas Cookies), and Jet Jurgensmeyer (Last Man Standing, American Sniper).

programme.title: The Deadly Companions
programme.desc: When a former Army officer accidentally kills a woman's young son, he offers to escort the grieving mother through dangerous Indian territory on the way to lay the boy to rest at the family homestead.

programme.title: High Lonesome
programme.desc: A sudden and swift series of murders occurs in southwestern Texas, sending Big Bend country into a frenzy. All parties are suspicious of a young rambler who just moved to the area, believing his presence must be related to the crimes.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E13 Deadline While Cheyenne works for Charley Dolan, he finds himself in the middle of a battle between Dolan and Len Garth, a gang leader who forces Dolan and others off their land. Garth soon burns the newspaper office, but Dolan aims to rebuild.

programme.title: County Line
programme.desc: When his best friend, Sheriff Clint Thorne (Jeff Fahey, Texas Rising, Justified), is brutally gunned down, former neighboring county sheriff, Alden Rockwell (Tom Wopat, The Dukes Of Hazzard, Longmire) is left with many questions and no answers. programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E13 Deadline While Cheyenne works for Charley Dolan, he finds himself in the middle of a battle between Dolan and Len Garth, a gang leader who forces Dolan and others off their land. Garth soon burns the newspaper office, but Dolan aims to rebuild.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E6 Misty Makes a Match The cowboys are in for a busy week when they're called upon to capture a wild hog that has been getting into a neighbor's garden. They also search a swamp for a calf that goes missing when they move their herd. Cody and Misty get serious about finding a name for their baby boy, so they study their family trees for inspiration. After a disastrous attempt at Internet dating, Booger takes one more shot at dating and agrees to go on a blind date that Misty arranges. Will he finally find a woman that understands the cowboy way of life?

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E7 Frost Moves In Bubba and Cody rush to get their grass planted before the first frost, but they need a bigger tractor to get the job done. Bubba ends up building a horse stall for a neighbor in exchange for the use of his tractor. Booger's relationship with Jaclyn gets serious, and he meets her son for the first time. Cody and Booger rescue a cow from a huge dirt pit, and Cody receives a load of dirt for the foundation of his dream home. Finally, Kaley surprises Bubba with the news that their baby girl is going to arrive sooner than expected.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E11 The Promoter Con man Jack Scully comes to North Fork with his friend, Reuben Miles, a simple-minded young man who is fast with a gun. Scully uses the young gun to win money by coaxing people into gunfights. Lucas becomes the next target.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E12 The Illustrator Hannah Shaw waits excitedly for New York artist Jeremiah Crowley to come to North Fork to paint her portrait. When he finally arrives, Hannah discovers he is a drunkard and is in trouble with the law. Lucas, as acting marshal, tries to help him out.

programme.title: Legal Action
programme.desc: Big-city lawyer Casey McKay, (Eric Close - Nashville, Without a Trace) a winner with a long hot streak, didn't expect the mysterious text from his ex-wife, Pru, (Tanya Clarke - A Beautiful Mind, Guiding Light) about her brother, Jay. No stranger to being on the wrong side of the law, Jay is accused of murdering a District Attorney. Casey takes the case, but soon discovers this will be no ordinary legal defense. Teaming up with eccentric ex-marine turned motel owner and P.I. "Ex" Clemens, (Nick Searcy - Justified, The Shape of Water) he discovers a web of conspiracy that puts him face-to-face with the town's most greedy and corrupt land developer, Mr. Gates (Tommy Flanagan - Sons of Anarchy, Braveheart). As Casey begins to unravel the truth, he finds himself fighting for his former brother-in-law's life, as well as his own.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: It's the late 1800s and a marshal must stop a volatile and growing conflict between homesteaders and cattle drivers in his small town on the Kansas frontier.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: S4 E1 The Jud Steele Story A posse pursues Jud Steele, a wanted gunslinger, and his partner. They join the wagon train to rest their horses. Steele dies trying to steal fresh horses. Hawks returns his belongings to the sheriff, who says Steele died five years ago.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E13 The Young Englishman Lucas and Mark discover a young calf is missing and traces it to the nearby Ashford Ranch run by an Englishman. When Lucas accuses foreman Norv Waggoner of cattle rustling to build up his own herd, Norv plans retaliation.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E14 The Gaucho Curge Palmer is upset after Argentinian Juan Argentez bought a ranch he wanted. Palmer insults Argentez and his children, Nita and Manolo. Meanwhile, Manolo's anger over who is courting Nita gets him into trouble when her suitor is found dead.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E15 The Pet Lucas and Mark find out a pony they adopted after the owner was killed may have anthrax. Fears of an epidemic rise in town. Meanwhile, the killer comes to the McCain Ranch thinking that Lucas has valuable information.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E16 The Sheridan Story At the end of the Civil War, General Sheridan and his staff arrive at the McCain Ranch. Trouble begins when ex-confederate soldier and hired hand Frank Blandon confronts the general, who shot and wounded him in the war.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E12 The Empty Gun Cheyenne meets gunslinger Matt Reardon, who rescues him from a fight. Reardon asks for Cheyenne's help as he plans to aid the widow of a man he accidentally killed. However, the dead man's son as other plans for Reardon.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E13 White Warrior Cheyenne leads a wagon train and goes through Apache territory. Along the way, he meets a band of braves and tries to free a teenage captive from them. However, the young man isn't sure that he wants to be free.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E6 Misty Makes a Match The cowboys are in for a busy week when they're called upon to capture a wild hog that has been getting into a neighbor's garden. programme.desc: S3 E12 The Illustrator Hannah Shaw waits excitedly for New York artist Jeremiah Crowley to come to North Fork to paint her portrait. When he finally arrives, Hannah discovers he is a drunkard and is in trouble with the law. Lucas, as acting marshal, tries to help him out.

programme.title: Legal Action
programme.desc: Big-city lawyer Casey McKay, (Eric Close - Nashville, Without a Trace) a winner with a long hot streak, didn't expect the mysterious text from his ex-wife, Pru, (Tanya Clarke - A Beautiful Mind, Guiding Light) about her brother, Jay. No stranger to being on the wrong side of the law, Jay is accused of murdering a District Attorney. Casey takes the case, but soon discovers this will be no ordinary legal defense. Teaming up with eccentric ex-marine turned motel owner and P.I. "Ex" Clemens, (Nick Searcy - Justified, The Shape of Water) he discovers a web of conspiracy that puts him face-to-face with the town's most greedy and corrupt land developer, Mr. Gates (Tommy Flanagan - Sons of Anarchy, Braveheart). As Casey begins to unravel the truth, he finds himself fighting for his former brother-in-law's life, as well as his own.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: It's the late 1800s and a marshal must stop a volatile and growing conflict between homesteaders and cattle drivers in his small town on the Kansas frontier.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: S4 E1 The Jud Steele Story A posse pursues Jud Steele, a wanted gunslinger, and his partner. They join the wagon train to rest their horses. Steele dies trying to steal fresh horses. Hawks returns his belongings to the sheriff, who says Steele died five years ago.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E13 The Young Englishman Lucas and Mark discover a young calf is missing and traces it to the nearby Ashford Ranch run by an Englishman. When Lucas accuses foreman Norv Waggoner of cattle rustling to build up his own herd, Norv plans retaliation.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E14 The Gaucho Curge Palmer is upset after Argentinian Juan Argentez bought a ranch he wanted. Palmer insults Argentez and his children, Nita and Manolo. Meanwhile, Manolo's anger over who is courting Nita gets him into trouble when her suitor is found dead.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E15 The Pet Lucas and Mark find out a pony they adopted after the owner was killed may have anthrax. Fears of an epidemic rise in town. Meanwhile, the killer comes to the McCain Ranch thinking that Lucas has valuable information.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E16 The Sheridan Story At the end of the Civil War, General Sheridan and his staff arrive at the McCain Ranch. Trouble begins when ex-confederate soldier and hired hand Frank Blandon confronts the general, who shot and wounded him in the war.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E12 The Empty Gun Cheyenne meets gunslinger Matt Reardon, who rescues him from a fight. Reardon asks for Cheyenne's help as he plans to aid the widow of a man he accidentally killed. However, the dead man's son as other plans for Reardon.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E13 White Warrior Cheyenne leads a wagon train and goes through Apache territory. Along the way, he meets a band of braves and tries to free a teenage captive from them. However, the young man isn't sure that he wants to be free.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E8 An Extra Hand Cody, Bubba, and Booger audition a bunch of local cowboys and non-cowboys to find a ranch hand that can help out when Bubba takes time off to be with his new baby. Bubba and Kaley risk one last trip to Mississippi for a baby shower. Kaley wants to see her family, but they worry that the baby will come early and be born outside of Alabama. After meeting with his banker, Booger is forced to sell off his family's land, but he desperately hopes to find a buyer willing to let him keep a small portion with his grandmother’s house.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E9 New Beginnings Bubba and Kaley welcome their baby girl into the world. When they get home from the hospital, Kaley surprises Bubba with a special gift. Cody lands a big contracting job with a local rancher, but the work needs to be completed in a week. He needs this job to fund the construction of his dream home, so he must get the work done somehow. Booger is beginning to think that Jaclyn might be the one, so he decides to introduce her to his grandma. Finally, the whole gang gets together for a Faith Cattle family barbecue to meet baby Andie.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E13 The Silent Knife Mark, a young mute boy, arrives in North Fork. When townspeople treat Mark badly because he cannot speak, Lucas and his son, Mark, befriend him. Desperate for cash, the boy steals $500 from a stagecoach line. Lucas convinces him to return the money.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E14 Miss Bertie Bertie Hoakam, a lively little old lady, comes to North Fork. She tells Lucas and Micah of her plan to capture a ruthless bandit for the reward money to support herself. To everyone's surprise, she succeeds with her plan.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Spirit of Truth After his fur trapping expedition is surprised by a Crow war party, legendary mountain man Jim Bridger suddenly finds himself in a desperate struggle to rescue his fellow trappers when one of them goes missing, and another is on the brink of madness.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Fossil Feud When bloodthirsty Canadian trappers try to kill him, mountain man Jim Bridger takes cover in an unexplored valley. There, he runs headlong into a family of escaped slaves who show him the huge footprints and fossilized bones of long-dead monsters.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E13 The Four Dead in Five Seconds Gunfight After two Mexican vaqueros cross the border in search of their stolen cattle, they are gunned down by the rustlers. When El Paso's newly appointed marshal arrests local ranch hands for the murders, he sparks one of the West's most infamous gunfights.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E5 The Gold Rush Detectives When gold goes missing from a safe in a remote mining town, Wells Fargo sends detectives Henry Johnson and Isaiah Lees to hunt down the culprits. Though the two men couldn't be more different, they must learn to work together to crack the case.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E1 Anne Bailey: Horseback Heroine After Anne Bailey's husband is killed by Native Americans, she defies the social norms of the frontier and becomes a horseback courier, risking her life to race through hostile territory delivering vital supplies to isolated forts and settlements.

programme.title: Fauda
programme.desc: After retiring from the Israel Defense Force, Doron is working on a vineyard. He gets roped back into active duty, though, upon learning that an enemy who Doron thought his unit had killed is still alive and plans on attending his brother's wedding. Doron rejoins the IDF team with the intention of going under cover at the wedding, but the plan goes awry when the team's cover is blown. That sets into motion a chaotic chain of events and leads IDF into a manhunt to locate and kill the squad's target.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Ben Cartwright is the patriarch of an all-male Nevada ranching family. Set during and after the Civil War, "Bonanza" is the story of life on the family's thousand-acre spread, known as the Ponderosa, near Virginia City. Ben has his three sons, each with a different (and deceased) mother. Serious eldest son Adam hopes to follow in his father's footsteps; middle son Hoss is a gentle giant -- physically strong, but sometimes naive; and youngest son Little Joe is the most impetuous and romantic of the offspring.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Flip Side
programme.desc: The hilarious new survey game show explores answers to questions from differing perspectives; host Jaleel White.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: Jeff Hephner challenges contestants who are ranked based on their answers to trivia questions for a chance at $10,000; every question counts, as each answer can propel them to the top or to the bottom, where they'll be in jeopardy of elimination.

programme.title: People Puzzler
programme.desc: Leah Remini hosts the show, which features three contestants who put their pop culture knowledge to the test to complete crosswords from the pop culture magazine. During a player's turn, one word out of 10 is chosen from the board. The contestant is then shown the first unrevealed letter in the word, and a clue is given, with correct answers scoring points based on the word. The player who wins the most points after three rounds moves forward to the fast puzzle bonus round, where they get the opportunity to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Master Minds
programme.desc: Three challengers take on some of the great minds in trivia in a showdown of smarts and strategy; the last contestant standing will face off against the highest scoring Master Mind in a head-to-head battle.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: Game show series have been making a comeback in television, and media and "America Says" is no exception. This program is following in the footsteps of the popular mobile app game "HQ Trivia." The network is planning its own spin on the game show, and Fran Shea, evp, programming and marketing, says she "has been studying the GSN audience and prepared a slate of new shows that reflect what it wants: family-friendly, fun, escapist television." In "America Says," two teams face off to guess Americans' responses to questions covering a variety of topics. Michael Higgins is the host.

programme.title: Flip Side
programme.desc: The hilarious new survey game show explores answers to questions from differing perspectives; host Jaleel White.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: This incarnation of the word-association game show that dates back, in various forms, to the early '80s is hosted by radio personality Mike Catherwood ("Loveline"). The premise is simple: two teams try to complete chains of seven words. The first and last word in each chain are revealed, and the contestants must guess the missing words, with one letter being revealed each turn. Each link in the chain forms a compound word or phrase with the word before and/or after it. Teams earn money for each word they guess correctly, and the team with the most money at the end of the game goes on to the bonus round, dubbed the Super Chain, for a chance to add an additional $5,000 to the total the team won during the main part of the game.

programme.title: Beat the Bridge
programme.desc: An interactive bridge dares players to cross by stepping on the right answers to challenging trivia questions; each step forward puts money in the team's bank, with bonus money for each successful crossing.

programme.title: Beat the Bridge
programme.desc: An interactive bridge dares players to cross by stepping on the right answers to challenging trivia questions; each step forward puts money in the team's bank, with bonus money for each successful crossing.

programme.title: Tic Tac Dough
programme.desc: Two contestants compete to place three marks in a row on trivia board avoiding a dragon that can steal turns; the winner faces the dragon in a final round where it blocks three-in-a-row attempts to prevent the $10,000 prize win.

programme.title: Bingo Blitz

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Everyday people battle a variety of trivia questions and a 40-foot wall for a chance to win millions of dollars. Each pair of deserving contestants, from siblings to spouses to best friends, has a plan to use the life-changing winnings for good things. But defeating the wall is no easy feat. Executive Producer LeBron James' game is a true test of both knowledge and poise. With momentary changes between fortune and failure, the outcome is as unpredictable as the bounce of the ball.

programme.title: Press Your Luck
programme.desc: Three contestants compete against one another in a game of wits and strategy, answering questions to earn spins on the Big Board. The stakes get even higher when the contestants get the chance to use their spins to win cash and prizes while trying to avoid the WHAMMY, who could take all of their winnings and leave them with nothing. The winning contestant moves on to the bonus round to face the WHAMMY in a final battle for the chance to win a fortune.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Switch

programme.title: People Puzzler
programme.desc: Leah Remini hosts the show, which features three contestants who put their pop culture knowledge to the test to complete crosswords from the pop culture magazine. During a player's turn, one word out of 10 is chosen from the board. The contestant is then shown the first unrevealed letter in the word, and a clue is given, with correct answers scoring points based on the word. The player who wins the most points after three rounds moves forward to the fast puzzle bonus round, where they get the opportunity to win a cash prize.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: Game show series have been making a comeback in television, and media and "America Says" is no exception. This program is following in the footsteps of the popular mobile app game "HQ Trivia." The network is planning its own spin on the game show, and Fran Shea, evp, programming and marketing, says she "has been studying the GSN audience and prepared a slate of new shows that reflect what it wants: family-friendly, fun, escapist television." In "America Says," two teams face off to guess Americans' responses to questions covering a variety of topics. Michael Higgins is the host.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: A heart-racing quiz show where three competitors face off against the Chaser, a ruthless quiz genius determined to stop them from winning cash prizes. Each episode is a fast-paced battle of brainpower, where contestants are challenged to think faster than they ever thought possible to answer up to 166 questions across all topics.

programme.title: Match Game
programme.desc: Actor Alec Baldwin hosts - and executive produces - the newest iteration of the iconic panel game show in which four contestants try to match answers given by six celebrities to humorous and often risque fill-in-the-blank questions. The famous panelists range from quick-witted comics to stars of the stage and screen.

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Airing from 2005 to 2009 on NBC, the game show series returns to primetime TV with original host Howie Mandel. A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash - from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Airing from 2005 to 2009 on NBC, the game show series returns to primetime TV with original host Howie Mandel. A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash - from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.
